text:
<taskdef name="wsdeploy" classname="com.sun.xml.rpc.tools.ant.Wsdeploy" 
classpathref="app.classpath"/>

Very easy to reproduce the error-
NoClassDefFoundError org.apache.xml.serializer.OutputPropertiesFactory.class

  <target name="process-war" depends="raw-war"
          description="Runs wsdeploy to create a deployable or 'cooked' WAR 
file">
    <echo message="Running wsdeploy..."/>
    <delete file="${dist.home}/${deployable-war}"/>

    <wsdeploy verbose="${jaxrpc-tool-verbose}" keep="true"
              tmpdir="${build.home}/server"
              outwarfile="${dist.home}/${deployable-war}"
              inwarfile="${dist.home}/${portable-war}">
      <classpath>
    	<fileset file="C:/xalan/XALAN-~1/serializer.jar">
    	</fileset>      
      </classpath>
    </wsdeploy>
    
  </target>

produces:

java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: 
org/apache/xml/serializer/OutputPropertiesFactory
as you can see serializer.jar which contains OutputPropertiesFactory is 
defined within the classpath but wsdeploy ignores it

Is there a workaround???
Martin-

creator: mbenson@apache.org
text:
You need to consult the manual for <taskdef> and <typedef>.  the classpath you
use with them is the one that needs to contain this third-party task.  Any
problems you have with the task specifically you should take up with its providers.
